## what does the data explorer do?  
You can choose between the datasets (and the code is at my github and you can add and improve code if you want to):

> 1. mtcars
> 2. airquality
> 3. iris

>  then you can choose between variables of the dataset to be plotted to each other and the regression line will be added in a plotly plot, for example like this:  
>  *  
```{r echo=F, eval=TRUE, message=FALSE, out.width='35%'}
dataToPlot <- mtcars 
plottitle <- "mtcars"
library(plotly)
# linear regression 
       fit <- lm(dataToPlot[,3] ~ dataToPlot[,2], data = dataToPlot)
       # plotly 
dataToPlot %>% plot_ly(x= dataToPlot[,2]) %>%
                                layout(title = paste0("dataset: ",plottitle),
                                 xaxis = list(title = colnames(dataToPlot)[2]),
                                 yaxis = list(title = colnames(dataToPlot)[3])) %>% 
           add_markers(y = ~dataToPlot[,3]) %>% 
           add_lines(x = ~ dataToPlot[,2], y = fitted(fit))
```
